intro: Ptilotus luteolus, commonly known as the yellow spinifex, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Its small, spiky leaves and showy blooms make it a distinctive feature of its native landscape. Ptilotus luteolus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in degraded environments.
